characters: ALONG WITH THE PRESERVED SHARK CARCASS.
THE BLADE OF A LARGE KNIFE
OH MY GOD I SHOT YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC BLARES. We move past people drinking, playing POOL, DARTS, BEER PONG and land on... MAX (30's) sitting with a team in matching T-shirts. (His says, “CAPTAIN.”) It’s a rowdy PUB TRIVIA NIGHT. Max poun a drink and yells at his team:

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (slightly slurred) Who cares about winning?! Let’s get drunk! His team CHEERS. Max walks over to the BARTENDER, dead so

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need four shots of Everclear and four shots of water. (throwing down some bills) Send the real ones to the other team. Give us the water. The Bartender snorts and starts pouring.

dialogues.speaker: TRIVIA EMCEE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What former Supreme Court Justice--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (spinning around) Oliver Wendell Holmes! Max’s team CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: TRIVIA EMCEE
dialogues.text: (annoyed) That is correct. Again, I’d like to ask the players to allow me to--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: --finish the question! His team laughs and cheers again. Across the room, also wearing a “CAPTAIN” shirt, ANNIE (3 glares at her TEAMMATES, including BILL, a schlubby guy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Come on, guys. Focus. This isn’t a game!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: It literally is.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Bill, I swear to god--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For triple points: what is the name of the purple Teletubby? The room quiets... There’s an intense beat then--

dialogues.speaker: MAX ANNIE
dialogues.text: Tinky Winky! Tinky Winky! Max and Annie lock eyes, sparks flying.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (intense) He always carried a--

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (unblinking) --red purse. I know. There is a definite connection here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Annie stand in the middle of a subway car, furiou making out. The car suddenly comes to a stop and the coup goes FLYING INTO A METAL POLE. In a MONTAGE, Max and Annie WIN different GAME NIGHTS as their relationship progresses: --A SMALL STUDIO APARTMENT, playing the board game RISK w another COUPLE, DAN and LINDA.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: If you take Kamchatka and I take Mongolia, we can trap Linda in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Starve out her army. Smart.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Hey! You can’t form alliances.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Worked for Hitler. They high-five.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: You're high-fiving Hitler?! --In A NICER APARTMENT, playing PICTIONARY. Max haphazard DRAWS a RECTANGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel”! Other players protest. Max and Annie kiss. --IN THEIR MODEST SUBURBAN HOUSE, playing CHARADES with B Max points to Bill and Annie guesses--

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bill. Overweight. Single. Out of work.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hairy? (Max touches his nose) Hairy. Carry. Mary. (Max touches his nose) Mary! (Max points to himself) You! Me! Max gestures to put it together.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marry me! Annie does a crazy/cute victory dance but then:

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait-- What? She turns back and sees Max on one knee, holding a ring.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Marry me, Annie. Annie jumps into Max’s arms, laughing and kissing him. Bi is still stinging from their insults.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (half-hearted) Congrats. Happy for you guys. --AT THEIR WEDDING RECEPTION, Max and Annie play a DANCIN VIDEO GAME in their tux and wedding dress. Dancing in unison, as their score mounts. The SONG crescendos to... TITLE UP: “GAME NIGHT”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a paper football about to be flicked at a finger goalpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotta pressure here. You miss, you lose.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stay outta my head, please. Max and Annie sit in a doctor’s waiting room playing pape football. Her hands are the goal. He’s about to “kick.”

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Y’know, you do have the advantage because your fingers are smaller than mine which means you have a smaller goalpost.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Guess you should’ve married Uma Thurman.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Guess I should’ve. Max aims, but just as he’s about to flick the paper footb his PHONE PINGS an incoming text. The “football” flies wildly far from the goal.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Awww. I’m sorry, honey. I know how much this meant to you.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That was interference. He reads the text. It’s from BROOKS: “PSYCHED FOR TONIGHT The words are followed by the GIF of THE OBESE BOY DANCIN CRAZILY ON A SOFA. Max sighs, annoyed. A NURSE enters.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Doctor Chin is ready for you. INT. DR. CHIN’S OFFICE - DAY Max and Annie sit across a desk from DR. JOHANNA CHIN, 40

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: .-.I think we've determined why you've been having trouble conceiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Chin turns and looks at Max.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What? It’s me? Of course it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: (opening a file) I’m not loving your semen.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: Your count is excellent. But your motility is well below normal.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What would cause that?

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: It can be genetic. Environmental factors. Nine times out of ten it’s just stress.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m not stressed.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: Nothing at home or work?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No. It’s all good.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What about your brother?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Chin) His brother, Brooks, emailed a couple months ago that he’s coming into town this week. Max has always had an inferiority complex with him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That’s not true. And she doesn’t need to hear this. She’s not a therapist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I am a doctor and I believe in treating the whole patient.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: He’s been on edge lately.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: What is it about your brother that intimidates you, Max?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Really? We’re gonna do this right next to the room where I masturbated?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Max has it in his head that Brooks is more successful and better looking and just generally cooler than he is.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I never said “cooler.” Now you're projecting.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Chin) He’s just naturally charismatic.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: (jots down some notes) Very interesting. And is he single?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I mentioned it, but Keith and I are on a trial separation.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: Don’t be. Keith was emotionally abusive. (then, to Max) You think your brother would want to grab a cup of coffee with me?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I-- I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can ask him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: Now, is he a tall fella? Because I’m only 5'2”.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So we’re done with my sperm, then? Annie and Dr. Chin ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: He’s definitely taller than Max. But he once dated this ballerina and she was a tiny little thing-- y'know, I’m starting to love this idea.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: Me too. Is he Google-able? Max throws up his hands as they continue to talk about ho great Brooks is. EXT. MAX’S & ANNIE’S HOUSE - EVENING Max and Annie pull into the driveway of a SUBURBAN HOME. grabs some groceries from the trunk and they head toward door. They spot their stiff neighbor, GARY (40, think Michael Shannon, wearing a police uniform) standing at hi mailbox. On a leash is a small, white puffball of a DOG.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Annie) Shit. It’s Gary. Don’t mention game night.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Good evening, Max. Annie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Gary. How’s it going?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Well enough. Just checking the mail. Some people check it earlier in the day but there’s always a risk that the mail carrier hasn’t come yet. This spares me the chance of a futile trip to the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, it allows Bastian here the opportunity to urinate.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Well, have a good one.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (pointedly, glancing at groceries) Any plans for this evening? Perhaps a game night?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (uneasy) Oh, no. Annie and I are staying in.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I see. I do hope you’1ll keep me in mind for any future game nights. I always enjoyed the camaraderie of good friends competing in games of chance and skill.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah... we should do that again. But tonight it’s just the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Three bags of Tostitos “Scoops” I notice. They had a special. Three for one.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Three for one? How can that be profitable for Frito-Lay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shrug.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, you two enjoy each other. Often we don’t fully appreciate what we have until it’s gone. Awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay. They can’t think of anything else to say so they head ins  INT. KITCHEN - MAX AND ANNIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Max and Annie enter. He peeks outside from behind a curta

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Now if he sees the others we're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Well, I told everyone to park far away and sneak in quietly. (then, changing course) Are we being dicks? Should we just keep inviting him? It seems like he really wants to play.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No! Debbie was our friend. Gary was just the creepy husband we had to put up with. And he’s only gotten worse since the divorce. He’s like the butler at a haunted house.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’re right. We don’t actually owe him anything. He can always find people like himself to play with. Y'know, other weirdos. Just then, a kitchen window opens and a VERY HOT 20-SOMET GIRL, MADISON, crawls in. Max and Annie regard her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Can we help you?

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: (vocal fry) I’m okay. RYAN, 30’s, hoists himself in after her.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Why are you coming in the window?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You said to sneak in so Robocop wouldn’t see us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I meant sneak in the door but, okay... could you get your boot off our cutting board?  10.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Well, you were super vague about how we should sneak in-- Just then, another window slides open and KEVIN, 30's African-American, starts climbing inside.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Jesus. It’s like “Night of the Living Dead” in here. Kevin helps his wife, MICHELLE, 30's, African-American, climb in.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I am not dressed for this nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’re asking a lot of us, Max.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I didn’t tell anyone to come in the window.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Guys, this is Madison. Madison, this is Max and Annie. Kevin and Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you brought her last week. (to Madison) You work at Forever 21, right? Ryan gives Annie a “what the fuck” look.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: (vocal fry) I work at Sephora.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I’m confused.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (sotto to Annie) Different girl. Same look, same voice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: You too.  11. Madison holds out an awkward limp hand, like a dead tish. Max and Annie try to figure out what to do with it. Annie shakes it awkwardly. Max kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you guys have a bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yes we do. Right down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: On the right or the left. I don’t want to go in the wrong room.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’ll be the one with the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: ‘Kay. Madison exits.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Where’d you meet her? At a TED talk?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Don’t judge me. Brains and personality aren’t everything.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Aren't you sick of losing game night every week ‘cause of the dates you bring?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: They’re not always bad.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK TO
dialogues.text: --Ryan plays charades. He frantically mimes a clue for hi partner, HOT DATE #1. We REVEAL she isn’t paying any attention to him. Instead she’s on SNAPCHAT, taking a selfie with the “licking dog” filter. On it she’s written “Game night. Bored AF.”

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Heather! How many pictures of you as a dog do you need? The others look embarrassed. --Ryan’s HOT DATE #2 puts down a word in Scrabble and cla happily.  12.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: “Dennis” isn’t a word.

dialogues.speaker: HOT DATE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, it is. It’s my daddy’s name, SO... The group roll their eyes. --Ryan and a HOT DATE #3 play Taboo. His card reads “Seal Team Six.”

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Okay, these are, like, the very best, the elite--

dialogues.speaker: HOT BLONDE DATE
dialogues.text: White people?

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Whoaaaa! BACK TO SCENE.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Unlike you psychos, I don’t really give a shit about winning at game night. I don’t need that validation.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: But you do need the validation of dating hot women.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) Oh yeah. (then) I’m sorry I’m not like you, Michelle. We didn’t all meet our soulmates when we were ten years old. Kevin smiles and puts an arm around Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: We didn’t get married till we were nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: And this was back in Iran? Or Westeros?  They kiss. 13.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Y’know what, Ryan? I hope someday you find a girl who you love as much as I love my sweet baby here. Ryan grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (heading to living room) Everybody have a drink? What should we play first?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Y'know what rich people are doing on their game nights these days?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fight clubs. I just read about them. They pay poor people to fight each other and they bet on the winner.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: That’s not a real thing.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yuh-huh. When you can have anything you want in the world, you have to raise the stakes or life gets boring. The Kennedys used to have fight clubs at their Hyannis Port compound.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You need to stop reading Buzzfeed every damn second of the day ‘cause that’s just pure silliness.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So... charades then?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to wait for Brooks?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Hold up. Brooks is in town? Madison returns.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I thought he was working in Europe.  14.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: He was. Apparently, he’s back here for business. I haven’t seen him yet.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: Who are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Max's brother. He’s this super- successful venture capitalist.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: He was the first to invest in Panera Bread. Turned it into America’s leading fast casual dining chain.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He’s the Mark Wahlberg to Max’s Donnie.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Y’know what? I’m gonna take that as a compliment because Donnie was fucking great in “The Sixth Sense.”

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Was he in that?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was. And you know who wasn’t? Mark Wahlberg.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: Mark would never take a role that small.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh, he wouldn’t, Madison? Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We haven't seen Brooks since your wedding. Remember that speech he gave?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen you cry that much.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We were all crying. What was that lovely poem he read?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: “Ancient Snapshots” by Joyce Carol Oates.  15.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That’s right. And then he paid for that whole fireworks display. There’s a beat as the friends fondly remember how awesome Brooks is. Finally,

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So, you guys wanna play or...?

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: From outside the house, a loud CAR HORN is accompanied by blaring sound of BILLY JOEL’S “CAPTAIN JACK” on the radio Annie and Max hurry to the window. Parked in front of their house, we see a shiny bright red 1976 Corvette Stingray with BROOKS at the wheel. He spots them and gives a friendly wave.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell him to park up the street?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I did! Like three times! (then, to himself) He got a Stingray? EXT. MAX & ANNIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Max sneaks out the front door and tries to signal--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (whisper-yelling) Turn off your car!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: What’s that? But it’s too late. Gary steps out his front door. Max wav at Gary awkwardly, caught.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey again. (under his breath) Still wearing the uniform... Brooks takes a 12-pack from his car and crosses the stree

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (too loud) Hey, bud. Sorry I’m late. I hope you didn’t start game night without me.  16.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (nodding toward Gary) Shh! Didn’t you get my texts?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: What texts? (then, to Gary) Evening, officer. (then, softly) What’s up with that guy?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to Gary) Gary, this is my brother. We’re just doing, like, a little three- man, family game night thing.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Three-man? What about Kevin, Michelle and Ryan? I thought they were coming.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, no, no. (to Gary) Just us, Gary.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (pointing) I can see them in your doorway. There’s a whole mess of people. REVERSE to see Kevin, Michelle, Annie, Ryan and Madison a huddled in the doorway, hiding from Gary.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, yeah. (to Gary) They’re not staying, Gary. It was a mix-up with the... Looking hurt, Gary goes back in his house and shuts the d

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God damn it, Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We didn’t want him to know we were doing game night. He used to come but we don’t like him anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Well, now he knows. Bring it in. I haven’t seen you in a year.  17. Brooks grabs him in a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You smell good. What is that, Selsun Blue? Head and Shoulders?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Why do you assume it’s dandruff shampoo?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: You've always been a bit of a snowstorm. Now where’s that wife of yours? He heads inside. INT. MAX & ANNIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Everyone ad libs greetings as they exchange hugs with Bro

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sweet ride, Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I just got her a couple weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Is that a Corvette?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: 1976 rally red Stingray Coupe. It was my dream car when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (innocently) Yeah, that’s what gave me the idea to get it. (then) I love your house.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Are you being sarcastic?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: No. I mean it. It reminds me of Mom and Dad's place. Takes me back to simpler times.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Simpler?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (chill out) Max. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then, to Brooks) So, how long are you in town for?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Not sure. Depends on how many clients my firm wants me to schmooze. But I’m hoping it’s for a while. I never get to see you guys. Brooks throws his arm around Max.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve missed you, man. Max looks at his brother and can’t help it, he smiles--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Missed you too. INT. LIVING ROOM - MAX & ANNIE’S HOUSE - LATER They’re about to play CELEBRITY.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: Say it one more time.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (a little impatient) Okay. You take a piece of paper from the bowl and then you give clues to the group and they try and guess who your celebrity is.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: Okay, got it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds. Starting... now. He starts a timer on his phone. Madison pulls out a name.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: I don’t know who this is.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Pick another one.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: (she does) I don’t know who this is.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Try another one. Quick.  19.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: (she does) Oh. Okay, this is the guy who-- no, wait. I don’t know who this is.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Maybe someone else should start. The others quickly agree. Brooks gets up.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I’ll go. Max rubs his palms on his pants. It’s on. Annie offers a bottle of wine to Max.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Do you want more--

dialogues.speaker: SHH
dialogues.text: Ryan starts the timer.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: And... go! Brooks pulls out a clue.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (raspy singing) “The beautiful people...”

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Marilyn Manson.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: You got it. (then, chuckling) Quick story. Brooks pauses the timer.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey, you can’t pause--

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Remember that urban myth that Marilyn Manson had some of his ribs removed so he could go down on himself?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah?  20.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Can I tell ‘em, Max?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No! You’re in the middle of a--

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Come on. You were 14. It’s an adorable story.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I forbid it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Now you’ve gotta tell us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Did you blow yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: You know those bungee cords you use on roof racks? Max wrapped one behind his neck and under his legs to try and squish his face down to his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: But he gets stuck like that. He can’t unhook it. Finally, after about an hour our mom comes home and finds him there. This naked pretzel boy on the floor of his bedroom. He’s had back problems ever since. The group is equal parts shocked and cracking up. Max is beet red. Annie rubs his back, consoling.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Aww, my little pretzel boy.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Did you suck it?  21.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We're not talking about this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Come on! That’s like turning off “Kramer vs. Kramer” before you see who gets the kid.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It’s really not. A deeply embarrassed Max grabs the timer and starts it ag

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Enough! The timer’s going.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Fine. Brooks launches into A RAPID-FIRE SERIES OF CLUES that ar spot-on, they are immediately guessed. He’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poor man’s Johnny Depp stars in “Jericho.”

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Skeet Ulrich.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: UN Secretary General from ‘92 to 196.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Boutros Boutros-Ghali.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Doesn’t like kids in “Jurassic Park.”

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Sam Neill.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Dubstep DJ looks like Corey Feldman.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Skrillex. ANGLE ON Madison. Like Ryan’s earlier date, she’s on SNAPCHAT, taking a selfie with the “licking dog” filter.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Rappers are obsessed with this Cubist painter.  22.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Picasso.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Big cat shot by asshole dentist.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Cecil the lion!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Time!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Whoa. Seven. That’s gonna be hard to beat.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Not that hard. I’11 go next. Brooks sits as Max steps up. Ryan starts the timer.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Gol! We see Max’s first celebrity on the paper: ED NORTON

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay, easy. Annie, the actor we met at the airport that time.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The only famous actor we ever met at the airport!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Bobby Flay?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (increasingly flustered He’s not an actor. He was in line in front of us at Sbarro? We were trying to figure out why he wasn’t in the first class lounge.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Who was that...?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Y'know, you’ve got a whole room of people here who can help out.  23.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Fine! He was the Incredible Hulk.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Eric Bana.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No! The other one.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Mark Ruffalo.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The other one!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Lou Ferrigno?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Shit! “Primal Fear.”

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Richard Gere didn’t play the Hulk.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Time's up.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Ed Fuckin’ Norton!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Ohh. Crap. Sorry. Max does a bad job of covering how pissed he is.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Zero points for Max. I’d say he blew it, but he won’t tell us. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone but Max and Annie laughs. INT. /EXT. MAX AND ANNIE’S HOUSE - LATER Max and Annie walk their guests out.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Hey, how about we do this next week at my house?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: House? What house?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Since I don’t know how long I’11l be here, I rented a place. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a couple miles away. Up on Broadmoor.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Ooh, swanky neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: It’s a cool place. But it’s pretty empty with just me. It’d be fun to have you guys over.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s kind of a tradition to do game night here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: So what? Could be fun. The others chime in with agreement.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Can we bring anything?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: No. I’ve got everything. (beat) Actually, Max, you may want to bring your own bungee cord. They all crack up.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Just gonna keep going back to that well, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m done. (then) I promise you guys: this will be a game night to remember. He hugs Max and gets into his Stingray. Max looks on with hint of envy, then shuts the door and begins helping Anni clean up.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Jackass.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: He’s just trying to get under your skin.  25.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, and he knows exactly how to do it. He’s been doing it my whole life. I don’t see him for a year, then he pulls up in MY dream car, insults our house and tells an embarrassing story about me right before my turn.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Buying the same car does seem like a bit of a “fuck you.” But maybe it was his dream car too.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Bullshit. He’s always known how to undermine me. You know I’ve never won a game against him?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Well, you’ve got to stop letting it bother you. It’s literally killing our baby.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Beat him? Max considers this. It’s a damn good idea. CUT TO BLACK. CHYRON: “ONE WEEK LATER” EXT. MAX & ANNIE’S HOUSE - DUSK Max and Annie head out toward his car with some board gam

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You don’t want to just Uber there?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m not getting drunk tonight. I’m gonna be sharp and ready for--

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Evening. They both jump and turn to see Gary standing there in the dark, as always in his police uniform, holding his dog.

dialogues.speaker: MAX ANNIE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Gary! AHH!!  26. They hide the board games.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Just going to my brother’s.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Another game night?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No! No game night. Just dinner.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I see. Pity. I was going to invite you over for a dinner I was hosting. I’ve purchased four lamb shanks. I’m simmering them in a broth of red wine and rosemary.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: That sounds yummy.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s too bad we have plans.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It was Debbie’s recipe. I like to think she left me her recipe cards as a gesture of goodwill. But most likely it was an unintentional oversight.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Uh huh. We should get going.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Have fun. Freaked out, Max and Annie head for the car. After a beat

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We didn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Gary stands there watching as they get into the car. EXT. BROOKS’ HOUSE/INT. CAR - NIGHT Max's car pulls up to a beautiful modern mansion.  27.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Guy who rents a house this big has to be covering up for something small.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, I’ve seen his dick. It’s pretty great.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Well, I tried. INT. BROOKS’ HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Brooks opens the door on Max and Annie. The place is all windows and technology. It’s annoyingly tasteful and awesome. Brooks offers them glasses of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Hey, guys.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey. Nice house, Tony Stark. Should we give our drink orders to Jarvis?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Ha! I got the Tony Stark part but then you went full nerd and I lost you. Come on in. They follow him into a beautiful living room where Kevin, Michelle and Ryan are having a drink with JILLIAN, a brig cute girl who seems way more normal than Ryan’s usual dat Ryan proudly presents Jillian like a prize--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh, hello friends. Allow me to introduce you to my date, Jillian. Jillian went to Yale University and is a software engineer at our office, so she’s smart as shit, okay? Kevin and Michelle exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, that was weird. (to Max and Annie) Nice to meet you guys.  28.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (they shake) You too. Ryan flips Max and Annie off from behind Jillian’s back.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So maybe you can’t always judge a book by its past... covers.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Odd use of that phrase. (to Brooks) We didn’t know what games you had, so we brought a few of our favorites.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Oh, cool. Thanks, guys. Brooks takes the games and THROWS THEM ACROSS THE ROOM. Pieces skitter across the stone floor.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I told you we're taking it up a notch. The game we’re playing is so epic, it doesn’t need a board or pieces.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Still, you didn’t need to throw them across the room.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I was being theatrical.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Are we doing a fight club?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: These super-rich guys pay poor people--

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No. Enough with the fight clubs. It’s nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: So what are we playing?  29.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (dramatic) In your drinks I’ve placed a powerful neurotoxin. You have eight hours to find the antidote hidden somewhere in the city. They all exchange looks of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m just fucking with you. But this is not a joke: in the next hour, someone in this room will be taken. It’ll be up to you to find that person before they're murdered.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (excited) Is this a murder mystery party?!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Not just any murder mystery party. I found this company that does it super-real with legit actors. You won’t know what’s real and what’s fake. Cost me a shit-ton.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Fun!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: But wait. There’s more. Whoever finds the victim wins the grand prize: the keys to the Stingray.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Just the keys?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: No, Ryan. The whole car.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes! (to Jillian) You’re so lucky I brought you to this game night and not one of Max and Annie's.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hey.  30.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No, I just mean because this is better.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Come on, Brooks. You’re not actually gonna give away your car.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I need a write-off. Plus, my Audi is more practical.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: This is the best night ever.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: So what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Now we wait. Maybe play a little drinking game to pass the time.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We don’t play drinking games.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Tonight we do.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: How about “Never Have I Ever”?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Good one.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Annie) Is this all just to one-up us?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s trying to show us a good time.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, that’s not it. Annie rolls her eyes. Max heads off to the bathroom. EXT. BROOKS’ HOUSE - NIGHT A menacing BLACK VAN quietly pulls up and parks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men sit inside -- a scary-looking, squat BALD GUY (40 and a wiry creepy guy with a PONYTAIL (40s).  31.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: This the place? The Bald Guy pulls out a scrap of paper with an address scribbled on it -- 1765 Broadmoor Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: This is it. Ponytail dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: (into phone) We’re at the house. Looks like they’re all inside. Bald Guy takes out a photo of Brooks. Then Ponytail hands him A VERY REAL-LOOKING GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max exits the bathroom and hears a CLATTERING NOISE from kitchen. Curious, he slowly makes his way down the hall.. Just as he turns the corner he finds himself INCHES AWAY

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Fucking shit! Terrified, Max scrambles back against the wall. REVEAL it Brooks holding the knife. Max exhales.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (laughing) What the hell’s wrong with you? (re: the knife) It’s for the cheese.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t need a bigger one? Are we cutting a whole wheel of gouda? INT. LIVING ROOM - BROOKS’ HOUSE - NIGHT Max and Brooks return. Everyone plays the drinking game.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Never have I ever connected my work computer to a projector in the conference room while it was open to a WebMD page on chlamydia symptoms.  32.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dude! Not cool. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (grinning) Drink. He drinks.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: For the record. I didn’t have chlamydia. It was a pubic dermatitis.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Nasty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Ryan) I like her.... (then, to Jillian) I like you.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to target people with this game. It’s supposed to be generic things, like... never have I ever slept with a celebrity. The others nod. Without thinking, Michelle take a sip of drink. Halfway through the sip, she realizes Kevin is staring at her in surprise. She sets down her glass.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You've slept with a celebrity?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Hmm? No, no. I was just taking a drink separate from the game.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Why are you all nervous then?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (nervous ) I’m not nervous. Who’s turn is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I think it’s Max’s turn. It’s somebody’s turn. Somebody should go now.  33.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (to Ryan) What’s going on here?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (sotto) They’ve been together since middle school.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: How could you possibly have had sex with a celebrity when we've only had sex with each other?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You're making this into something it’s not. Max turns to Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This is why we don’t play drinking games.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Everyone jumps at the sound of banging. They all look at front door except for Kevin who stares at Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open up!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Looks like the game is afoot. He crosses to the door and opens it on an imposing, extre serious 40-something MAN in a dark suit and sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Are you Brooks Davis?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (mock serious) I am.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I’m Agent Henderson. FBI. Please sit down. Brooks joins the others as the man enters.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sunglasses at night. This guy’s the real deal.  34.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: I'll get right to the point. The Bureau has been tracking a ring of violent kidnappers in this neighborhood. We have reason to believe that one of you may be their next victim.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Quick question, Agent Henderson? Why is this a federal investigation? Seems more like a local police matter. Annie swats Max: “play along.” Agent Henderson glares at but says nothing. He hands each of them a folder.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: Contained in these dossiers are the clues you’ll need to find the kidnappers.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We have to find them? What’s the Bureau’s role in this?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Maybe the FBI can take my wife in for questioning. ‘Cause apparently, she’s got a whole secret life I don’t know anything about.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Honey--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: (barking) Shut up! All of you! This isn’t a joke! He gets up in Max’s face.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (intense) You people are in serious danger and we are running out of time here! I will not stand idly by and see more civilians slaughtered on my watch! Max glances over at Brooks and gives him a grudgingly impressed look.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: He’s pretty good, huh?  35.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: Now, before we get started I’m required to ask if anyone here has any food allergies-- BOOM!!! The FRONT DOOR IS KICKED OPEN, splintering off it hinges. Bald Guy and Ponytail walk in wearing ski masks.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? Ponytail COLD COCKS the “FBI Agent.” He goes down hard.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Guys! I know you’re “method” and all but you can’t just break my door-- Bald Guy walks up to Brooks and PUNCHES HIM IN THE GUT. Brooks doubles over.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay, I actually don’t mind this game. Brooks shoves the guy away.

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU CRAZY
dialogues.text: Ponytail grabs Brooks in a headlock from behind. Brooks backs up, slamming Ponytail into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Wow. This is kind of intense... The fight continues. It’s SLOPPY AND SURPRISINGLY VIOLENT Brooks does a decent job of defending himself. ANGLE ON the rest of the group sitting on the sofas calml eating chips and drinking cocktails like they’re watching movie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to Max) This is very well done.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hm. Ski masks are a little on the nose. Ponytail is shoved onto the coffee table in front of them Ryan plucks the champagne bottle out of his way in the ni of time. Brooks manages to get loose from the Bald Guy. He reaches down to his ankle and pulls out a SMALL HANDGUN.  36.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (playful) Watch out. He’s packin’ heat! Brooks aims the gun at Bald Guy but it’s knocked out of h hand by Ponytail. The gun skitters across the room and co to a stop at Annie’s feet. She looks down at it. The fight spills out of the living room and into the kitc INT. KITCHEN - BROOKS’ HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Brooks faces off against the two attackers, wielding pots utensils and whatever he can grab as a weapon. It’s like Bourne movie except these guys are not nearly as coordina INT. LIVING ROOM - BROOKS’ HOUSE The group are as we left them. We can hear the sounds of breaking glass, clattering pans and pained grunts coming the kitchen. After a beat, Max slices a sliver of cheese.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This is good.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Try it with the prosciutto.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Are we sure this is all part of the thing?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Brooks always goes all- out. (to the group) Remember that fireworks display he got for their wedding--?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Yeah, Ryan. We talked about that. Suddenly, Brooks flies into the room, landing on his back There’s broken glass in his hair and he’s got a bloody no

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Ooh, they put some makeup on him.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Help me! Please! This isn’t-- Bald Guy pins Brooks down and SLAPS TAPE over his mouth.  37.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (slow clapping) Very impressive. And the Independent Spirit Award goes to... Brooks tries to buck Bald Guy off of him. Ponytail takes gun out of his belt and points it at Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: Stop fighting, asshole! Bald Guy pulls out a bag and puts it over Brooks’ head. H and Ponytail drag the struggling Brooks out of the house. Bald Guy stops at the door and points his gun at the gang

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: First one that follows us out, I shoot in the face.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: M'kay, drive safe. The men hustle Brooks out. There’s a beat as the group continue to sip their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: There’s something about this that doesn’t make sense. (to Michelle) What did I do that made you want to cheat on me with a celebrity?!

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I didn’t cheat on you. It was before we got married. When we took that break.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Oh my god. My world is collapsing. As Kevin and Michelle bicker, Ryan crosses to the supine Agent” and nudges him with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Agent Henderson? You gonna keep lying there? He doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jillian) He’s a regular Daniel Day Lewis. Meanwhile, Max discreetly grabs one of the dossiers and h and Annie scurry off to another room. Jillian notices. Sh holds up another dossier to Ryan. They hurry off as well.  38.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Michelle) ...we both agreed we wouldn’t hook up with anyone during that break.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but then you went and got a handjob from Karen Waller.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: It was over the pants! And I felt guilty the whole time. But I guess I shouldn’t have.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You're making this into something-- (then noticing) Oh hell. They got the jump on us.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: grabs dossier) Come on! But this isn’t over. They hurry out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --IN THE KITCHEN, Max and Annie go over the dossier:

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Here's the first clue. It looks like a riddle. (reads ) With shiny fangs... --IN A BEDROOM, Ryan and Jillian read the rules:

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (reads ) ..-my bloodless bite... --IN A HALLWAY, Michelle reads:

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: .+-eWill bring together what’s mostly white.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Donald Trump!

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s it.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: How do you know? Did you fuck him?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: “Bloodless bite”? So it’s not a vampire. Let me Google this. She takes out her phone.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This is so inconsistent. They choreograph a super-realistic fight and then they give us an FBI dossier with riddles in it? Pick a tone and stick with it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Do you want that car or not?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: More than anything ever. But I feel like Brooks is setting me up here. This is just another game where somehow he’s gonna humiliate me. (then) I say we find a shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: How do we do that? Max notices her phone.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: His phone! It was in his pocket when they grabbed him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You want to call him?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I want to track him. He points to Brooks’ iPad lying on the kitchen counter. T give each other an excited look. INT. BEDROOM - BROOKS’ HOUSE - NIGHT Ryan and Jillian are studying the dossier.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: “Bloodless bite... bloodless bite... bloodless bite...”

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe stop saying “bloodless bite” so I can think?  40. They hear a CAR DOOR SLAM out the window. They glance out see Max and Annie getting in their car and backing out of driveway. She spots She finds

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Shit. They must've already figured it out. We’ve gotta up our game. There’s nothing more dangerous than Max when he’s got something to prove. (then) “Bloodless bite... bloodless bite...”

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Stop that! (then) We need to find an advantage. a wallet on the bedside table and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Brooks’ wallet? You think we should just steal all his shit?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: No. Brooks’ credit card and dials a number on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, hi. I lost my credit card and I’m wondering if you can tell me the last few charges I made?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (covering phone) If we can find the name of the murder mystery company he used we can go to their office and pay them off to give us the final clue.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Whoa. You are a double threat: brains and sneakiness.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (not exactly flattered) Thanks.  4l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and Michelle are still puzzling over the clue.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What has shiny fangs that bites white things together?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (getting it) A stapler! The white things are paper!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yes! I would kiss you but I don’t know where those lips have been. She rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Look around for a stapler. They move down the hall and enter INT. BROOKS’ STUDY - CONTINUOUS A windowless room with a skylight in the ceiling. Lots of bound books, a desk, etc.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Found one! He grabs a stapler off the desk and opens it. Inside is a FLASHDRIVE.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Here. Put it in the desktop. Kevin plugs it into the computer and a text box opens.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Another riddle.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (reads) “I am brown and old by day, white and young by night, my eyes are glass, I have nine faces but no head. I sing to the sky but I have no voice. I am everywhere and nowhere--”

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?!  42. INT. MAX’S CAR - NIGHT Annie drives while Max uses FIND MY IPHONE on Brooks’ iPa

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Are they still on Route 18?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yup. We’re catching up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Can you imagine Brooks’ face when we find him so fast?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be so good. Y’‘know, I think I can actually feel my sperm coming back to life.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Perfect. We'll win your brother's car and then go make a baby in it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah! And we'll make him watch us!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What? I don’t want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t either. I don’t know why I said that. INT. BROOKS’ HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Jillian finishes her call.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Great. Thank you. (hangs up) Let’s go. I got the game company’s name and address.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes! You rock. He goes to hug her. Expecting a high-five, she puts up a hand. It’s awkward. He ends up hugging her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Jillian head toward the living room. They pass t study where Michelle and Kevin are. Ryan stops.  43.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, just wanted to wish you the best of luck tonight. Kevin and Michelle look at him quizzically as he shuts th door to the study and PROPS A CHAIR UNDER THE HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh, being a dick. He heads out. She follows. INT. BROOKS’ STUDY - CONTINUOUS Kevin tries the door but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch. (calling through door) You son of a bitch! He throws his shoulder against the door. Nothing. He spot some candles on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hand me those matches. I’m gonna burn down this door.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You’re gonna light a fire ina windowless room that we’re trapped in?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: _ (pouty) Fine. Don’t hand me the matches.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (looking up) What about that? He looks up to see a SKYLIGHT twelve feet overhead. His e narrow. INT. MAX’S CAR - NIGHT CLOSE ON an iPad screen. The BLIP of Brooks’ phone stops moving, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hold on. Brooks’ phone just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Crap. Where did you last see it?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Corner of 5th and Kenmore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull into a deserted lot in a sketchy neighborhood. They get out of the car and look around.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Where could he be? Max notices a dumpster that sits behind an unmarked build He crosses to it and glances in. Inside he spots a cell phone. He retrieves it.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Found it. It’s turned off.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: He must’ve known we were tracking him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Damn it. They outsmarted us. (noticing) Hang on... He points across the street to where Ponytail is finishin cigarette outside of a dive bar. He heads back inside.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Isn’t that one of the actors?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess they’re not that smart. They high-five each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We are nailing this! Come on! They head across the street, instinctively staying low.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Why are we crouching?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Feels right?  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Annie enter, trying to look casual. There’s a BUR BARTENDER, a half-asleep DRUNK GUY, and in a corner booth facing away from them is Ponytail.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (sotto, re: Ponytail) There he is. Don’t let him see you. They take a seat at the bar. Max signals to the tattooed bartender.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir? You wouldn’t happen to have seen a guy brought in here. Looks a bit like me with a stronger chin, higher cheekbones.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: So, a better looking guy?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay, well, that’s not necessarily-- Annie gives the bartender a look to say “kind of, yes.”

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I didn’t see nothing. He moves off. Max’s eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: “Didn't see nothing”? That double- negative felt a bit forced, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I bet he’s in on it. Look at how fresh his tats are. Probably fake.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Let’s test him. We’ll order drinks only a real bartender would know how to make.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Smart. (calling) Barkeep?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Can I have a vodka tonic, please?  46.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I choked.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) I’ll take a Harvey Wallbanger. The bartender looks at him, annoyed. Then goes to make th drinks.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: This is kinda fun, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is nice to get out of the house. Y’know, we won’t be able to do this kind of thing when we have a kid.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: ‘Cause when you have a kid, you stop living for you and you start living for them. That’s why Brooks has got it made.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: So, what are you saying? Max just shrugs as the bartender sets down their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Vodka tonic. Harvey Wallbanger. Max takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Did he get it right?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I realize I’ve never actually had one. But it’s tasty. Tart. Suddenly, Max reacts as Bald Guy exits a back room, locks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: then tosses the keys to the Bartender. Behind him, we cat a brief glimpse of a man tied to a chair. It’s Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Brooks is back there. We’re about to win this thing!  47. Bald Guy has crossed over to Ponytail. He has noticed Max and Annie and he’s pointing them out to Ponytail.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Uh oh. They made us.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You think they’re gonna try and stop us?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We already know they take their roles pretty seriously. But the good news is, so do I. She reaches into her purse and pulls out the GUN BROOKS DROPPED EARLIER.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What the-- where did you get that?!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s the fake gun Brooks “dropped” in the fight.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: How do you know it’s fake?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You think your brother would use a real gun in a fake fight with actors he hired?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Good point. So, what are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Follow my lead. She gets to her feet and points the gun at the men.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting) Any of you fucking pricks move, and I'll execute every motherfuckin' last one of you!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: “Pulp Fiction.” Nice.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hand over the keys. We’re taking my brother.  48.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Caught up in her role, Annie gets closer to Bald Guy and her gun right at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You know what’s bullshit? Your bald fucking head.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Getting a little personal, hon.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (“angrily” to Bald Guy) I’m sorry I called you bald! It works on you because you have a very symmetrical face! (then) Okay, all of you. On your knees. Eyes shut. Hands in the air. Heads on the floor. The thugs try to comply but can’t remember everything. Th all assume different positions.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: Where’s my head go?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: On the floor! And close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: How do I put my hands in the air with my head on the floor?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I had the same question.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Okay, child's pose. You guys know child’s pose? They give her blank looks. She hands the gun to Max.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cover me. (then, to the men) It’s like this... She gets on the floor and demonstrates the position. The follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’re doing it right, you’ll feel your lumbar really opening up. Bald Guy gives Max a look of disbelief. Max just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Jillian step out of his car and head toward a sm storefront -- the party planning company, “Murder We Wrot

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: There it is!

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Looks like they’re still open.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I am so glad I invited you tonight. I usually bring these girls I want to sleep with and they always suck. You're a breath of fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Oh, nice. I usually go out with guys who are interesting and smart. So this is a first for me too.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Are we cool? Did I say something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: No. I guess I didn’t realize when you invited me tonight that it was just because you needed a ringer.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Ohh. You thought this was a date.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: It's fine. The more I get to know you, the happier I am that it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (oblivious ) So we are cool?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: As a cucumber. Let’s just win that car and get this night over with.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That’s the spirit!  50. He jogs toward the entrance. She shakes her head. INT. “MURDER WE WROTE” OFFICE - NIGHT Ryan and Jillian enter a small reception area. Behind a d a WOMAN sits facing away from us in a swivel chair.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Hello? No answer. She and Ryan exchange a look. Ryan slowly reaches out and swivels the chair around revealing... A DEAD WOMAN WITH A FRESH BULLET HOLE IN HER FOREHEAD. He eyes are closed. Blood trickles from the wound and the corner of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN/JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit!/Ahhh! Startled by the noise, the dead woman SUDDENLY OPENS HER EYES.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh! You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?!

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: What? (remembering, touches her forehead) Oh. I just came from a six hour murder mystery where I played the corpse. I guess I fell asleep before I cleaned up.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You scared the shit out of us.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. I do my own makeup. How can I help you? A bit of blood dribbles from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We need you to give us the final clue for the murder mystery Brooks Davis ordered.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: But that would ruin the fun.  51.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: We don’t want the fun. We just want to win.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (sly) . Would this change your mind? He slides a bill across the desk. It’s a ten dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What about this? He slides another bill across. It’s a five. She looks at him unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You drive a hard bargain. Okay, let's take it up a notch. He slides another bill. It’s a one. The Receptionist look at Jillian. Jillian shakes her head: “Don’t look at me.”

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was hoping I wasn’t going to have to dig this deep. He goes back into his wallet. Considers for a beat, then reluctantly slides another bill over. It’s another one dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, y’know what? It doesn’t matter how slowly you push it over. It’s still seventeen dollars. (to Receptionist) How much do you need?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: A hundred?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Give her a hundred.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fine. He slowly slides all the bills back toward himself, then slides a hundred dollar bill toward the woman. She reache into a drawer and hands a folded clue across the desk to them.  52.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jillian) And that’s how we do. INT. BROOKS’ STUDY - NIGHT Michelle watches nervously as Kevin finishes building a t of furniture, books and office equipment up to the skylig

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Just tell me who it was.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It’s irrelevant.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Not to me. If I have to imagine you lying underneath some famous figure, it makes a very big difference if I’m imagining John Goodman or Jeremy Renner.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It wasn’t either of them.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Will you tell me if I guess it right?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Was it an actor?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yes. Kevin starts to carefully climb up his pile.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Over 40?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yes. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: American?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Lee Jones?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Ew. No.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Was it Denzel? Tell me it wasn’t Denzel.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It wasn’t. Unfortunately. 53. Kevin has reached the ceiling. He unlatches the skylight pushes it open. He takes a breath of outside air.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Sweet freedom. Dipshit thought he could keep us locked up but we found a way out. The tower suddenly TIPS OVER. Kevin screams as across the room. He SLAMS INTO THE LOCKED DOOR impact smashes it open.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?! Kevin painfully gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What the fuck just happened? (realizing) Hey, we’re out. Come on! Michelle follows him out. INT. BROOKS’ LIVING ROOM - NIGHT he falls and the Kevin and Michelle enter to find “Agent Henderson” sittin the floor touching a cut on his head.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: (woozy) Where am I? Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: All right, take it easy, bud.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: Oh, my head.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Either give us a clue or get outta the way. ‘Cause we’ve got a mystery to solve.  54.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON
dialogues.text: (intense) Don’t you get it? That wasn’t supposed to happen! CRASH! Once again the front door is kicked open and TWO M enter wearing creepy clown masks. Michelle and Kevin jump

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What now? You already did the breaking in thing.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: This is some lazy writing.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: Shut up! Get on the floor, all of you! The clowns notice Agent Henderson’s injury.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: Whoa. Ron. Are you okay? The clowns pull off their masks revealing the faces of tw actors.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON/RON
dialogues.text: No, I’m not okay! Two guys came in here and attacked me!

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: You mean for real?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON/RON
dialogues.text: Yes! They weren’t part of our cast.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON/RON
dialogues.text: I knew I shouldn’t have left dinner theater for this bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Michelle) Now it’s getting meta.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: (dialing cell phone) I’m calling Glenda.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: I’1ll go make you a cold compress, Ron.  55.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON/ RON
dialogues.text: I think I may have a concussion.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: (rubbing his back) Aw, pal.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Wait. Is this all part of the act?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON/RON
dialogues.text: What?! No. Didn’t you see? I was assaulted!

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. “MURDER WE WROTE” OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Jillian and Ryan puzzle over the clue.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (reading) “Look in your jacket pocket”? What kind of clue is this? I don’t even have a jacket.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe it means a book jacket?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Why would a book have a jacket? The phone on the receptionist’s (GLENDA) desk rings. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST/GLENDA
dialogues.text: Murder We Wrote.

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: Glenda! It’s Paul. Something terrible has happened.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST/GLENDA
dialogues.text: Oh dear. What?

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: Nathan and I showed up for the takeaway and Ron had been attacked.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST/GLENDA
dialogues.text: Oh no! At the Brooks Davis house? Jillian and Ryan look up.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Huh?  56. Glenda puts the call on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST/GLENDA
dialogues.text: Is everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (yelling at the phone) No, I’m not okay Glenda! I’ve got a throbbing headache! And they took the host!

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST/GLENDA
dialogues.text: Who took him?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT HENDERSON/RON
dialogues.text: Kidnappers! Real ones! Dangerous fucking criminals! Off Kevin and Michelle’s and Ryan and Jillian’s look of shock, we return to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: “TAKE ON ME” by a-ha The upbeat music blares from a jukebox as Max frisks the Annie dances to the music, twirling the gun on her finger She drops it and it lands inches from Ponytail. Annie quickly snatches it back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I saw you eyeing that, Ponytail. Not on my watch. Max finishes collecting the weapons from the men and stic them in a bag. He finds keys on the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Bingo. (to Annie) Come on, babe. He moves to the backroom door and unlocks it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Okay, any of you dickwalls move a muscle I’1l shoot off your tits. You got me? The men grumble. Annie’s phone rings. She checks it. It’s Michelle. She hits “ignore.” Max and Annie enter the backroom and shut the door.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quickly lock the door behind them and turn to Brooks who is tied to a chair and gagged with tape. His eyes go wide when he sees them.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh, look at that face. That is priceless.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You did not expect us this early, did you? Brooks frantically grunts and tries to scream through his gag.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta capture this moment. He takes out his phone, poses beside Brooks with Annie on other side and snaps a selfie of the three of them. Just then, the phone rings. It’s Ryan. He shows Annie.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Probably begging for help. He hits “ignore.”

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I feel like maybe we should call that company and complain because this wasn’t much of a mystery. Brooks MOANS wildly, practically JUMPING OUT OF HIS CHAIR trying to communicate.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: All right, all right... She yanks off Brooks’ gag.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (as soon as the gag’s off) THIS ISN’T A GAME! BANG! Someone begins kicking the door from the other side

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Why, because we kicked your ass?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Max, THOSE ARE NOT THE GUYS I

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh I get it. Now you’re trying to change the rules on us? BANG! The door shakes.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I’m not a venture capitalist. I’m a smuggler!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: A smuggler? What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (scared) I fucked up. I sold the Bulgarian’s egg to a different guy and now I have to get it back or he’s gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Ooh, the Bulgarian’s egg. Did you trade it for the Maltese Falcon?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Wait. This isn’t the end?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You said whoever found you got the car. Game over.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I’m telling you. This isn’t a game! It’s all real! SMASH! The door starts to splinter.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Those shitty actors are real? That fight was real?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: This gun is real? She points the gun at the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Annie, stop!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh no. Bang bang-- She pulls the trigger. BANG! A REAL BULLET SHATTERS the hanging florescent light above them.  59. Startled, Annie drops the gun. It hits the tloor and FIRE

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: ow! Max looks down at his arm. It looks okay... until a red circle of blood appears through his shirt. Annie just sho him. A stunned beat, then--

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I told you! Untie me! Quick! Annie unties Brooks, her hands shaking as Bald Guy and Ponytail burst into the room. They spot the bag with their weapons and go for it as Max Brooks and Annie run to the rear emergency exit door. Ponytail and Bald Guy retrieve their guns and FIRE in the direction. BROOKS (CONT’D) Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, Max and Brooks sprint across the street to their c still screaming.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You shot me!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I know! I feel terrible! Annie runs over to the driver’s side and unlocks it, gett behind the wheel. Brooks jumps in the backseat as Annie peels out with Max in the passenger seat. Bald Guy and Ponytail race to their van, firing wild shot the car as they go.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: (another gunshot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They barrel around a corner. INT. MAX’S CAR - NIGHT Annie drives like a madwoman while Max clutches his arm--

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s all real! How did it all get real?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You shot me! I’m bleeding out of my arm. I’m gonna die tonight. Brooks reaches from the backseat and wraps a gym towel ar Max's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Here. Hold this on there. The van closes in on their car.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on, Brooks? Talk!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: They're right behind us!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I've been lying to you and the rest of the family about what I do. I buy and sell things that aren’t strictly legal for people who aren't strictly... good.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So you're a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Yes. And I made a mistake. There’s this guy. They call him the Bulgarian. He has his fingers in all these pies around the world.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What kind of pies?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Bad pies, Max. Pies that have heroin in them and guns and sex slaves. He asked me to find this Fabergé egg for him. And I found it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But then I heard about this other guy, Marlon Freeman, who was willing to pay twice as much for the same egg.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (re: the van) So these guys work for the Bulgarian? And they just happened to crash your murder mystery party?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
