dialogues.text: I know. What are they odds? (then) I never should've gotten into business with that guy. I’m too small-time for this shit! The van has caught up and suddenly SWERVES into the side their car. They FISHTAIL, nearly running onto the sidewal before Annie regains control and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We need to go to the cops!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: We can’t! He’s got cops on his payroll. I’11 be dead before I even get to jail.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then why don’t you go to this Marlon Freeman and buy the egg back from him?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I couldn't find him if I wanted. That name was an alias.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What do we do?! These guys aren’t stopping!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: They won’t stop till they get me. (making a decision) I’m sorry I dragged you into all this. I’m sorry for a lot of things. He opens his car door.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I love you, Maxie.  62. And with that, Brooks rolls out of the moving car. He lan hard on the street as the van SCREECHES TO A STOP a few f away from him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No! Stop the car! Annie brakes a couple hundred feet from the van. They loo back to see Ponytail and Bald Guy grab Brooks and haul hi toward the van. Bald Guy raises his gun and fires a couple shots in their direction. Annie steps on the gas and tears away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! Shit!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do? They’re gonna kill my brother. (then) I feel faint. I’m gonna pass out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We've gotta get you to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No! It’s a gunshot wound. They’1ll call the police.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: So, let’s go to a mob doctor!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Do you know a mob doctor?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Of course not!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Then why did you say a mob doctor?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Because I’m losing my shit here!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You're going to have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to take the bullet out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to.  63.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to either, hon. I’ve seen you try to cut a chicken. But we don’t have a lot of options. Off her look of nauseated horror,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie exits the convenience story with a bag of stuff. He phone rings. It’s Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. BROOKS’ KITCHEN - SAME TIME Michelle and Kevin share her phone. Ryan and Jillian stan nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Thank god. Listen, honey, it’s all real--

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We know. Brooks is caught up in something. Where are you right now?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: We're all at Brooks’s waiting to talk to the cops. Through a doorway, we see TWO POLICE OFFICERS taking a statement from Agent Henderson. An EMT tends to his head.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to the cops!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Why? What’s going on? Are you guys okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We're fine. I shot Max but he’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What?!  64.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We’ll meet you back at our house. Just don’t tell the cops anything. Brooks's life depends on it. Annie hangs up. Michelle digests this, then

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (quietly to the other) Come on. We’ve gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (full volume) Where are we going? She shoves him toward the kitchen door. The others follow

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (loudly) I thought we were gonna talk to the cops. Jillian rolls her eyes as she ushers Ryan out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 7-11
dialogues.text: Annie walks around to the rear of the store to find Max sitting on the hood of the car, cradling his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I got a bunch of stuff. She begins laying out items on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tweezers, pocket knife, gauze, sewing kit. Max picks up a bottle of white wine.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They didn’t have rubbing alcohol and they don’t sell hard liquor so I got this chardonnay. Max twists off the top and takes a slug, then notices a magazine in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Country Living magazine? What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s for later. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They have a butternut squash soup recipe that looked great. (then) Now put this in your mouth. She hands him a DOG’s SQUEAKY CHEW TOY in the shape of a hamburger. Max sighs and bites down on the toy. SQUEAK! Annie rolls up his sleeve and recoils at the bloody mess.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh god! She takes out her phone, types something and sets it on t hood.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (mouth full) What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Instructions on how to remove a bullet. It’s an alt-right militia website so I’m just gonna ignore the racist stuff... “Step one: sterile gloves.” She slips on a pair of rubber dishwashing gloves.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check. “Step two: clean wound with antiseptic.” She pours the wine over Max’s arm. SQUEAK!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. “Three: administer anesthetic.” Gonna skip that... “Four: apply pressure above the wound.” Here. Squeeze there. She takes his other hand and Max squeezes his injured arm

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Make small incision on each side of wound.” Oh jeez. Here we go. She opens the pocket knife, pours some wine on it and cut into his arm. SQUEEEEEAAK! She continues to cut. Max spit out the dog toy.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Nope! Too big! You're cutting too big! It’s a bullet, not a golf ball.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So much blood. He dry heaves a little.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you do that! You’re gonna make me-- DAWWWWWWW! She dry heaves. Max dry heaves. They manage to collect themselves.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was close. Okay, next step... shit!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: My phone went to sleep. Hang on. She takes off her glove and re-enters her passcode.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Just set it so it stays on.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: My phone doesn’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We have the same phone! It does that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s fine. 1I'’11 just touch the screen with my nose every 30 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Why are you so afraid of your phone? Just go to “settings,” then “display” then adjust the time before it reverts to sleep mode.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: “Revert”? What are you, Steve Jobs?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It's the easiest fucking thing!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Enough! I know what I’m doing!  67. She touches her nose to the screen. Max rolls his eyes. S reads the next step.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, this is going to hurt. Where’s your squeaky hamburger? She finds it and shoves it in his mouth. She takes the tweezers and begins digging around in the bullet hole. Ma writhes in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I feel something hard. I think I found the bullet... She taps something with the tip of her tweezers. We hear clinking sound. Max inhales painfully.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s really wedged in there. Why won't it come out? Oh wait. That’s bone. I’m sorry. Sweat and tears pour down Max’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t find it. Let me see what the racists say if you can’t find the bullet... She touches her nose to the phone again, then suddenly notices something on Max’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on. What’s this? Did you get shot twice?! She shows him a hole on the other side of his arm. Max sp out the chew toy again.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: God damn it, Annie. That’s an exit wound.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Well, that’s good news, right? Max looks like he’s going to faint. Annie inspects the wound.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (disgusted) This one’s even uglier than the entry wound. WHAAUUUGGGH! She dry heaves.  68.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Stop that-- BWAHHHHH! He dry heaves. They both dry heave together. INT. MAX AND ANNIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Max and Annie bring Ryan, Jillian, Kevin and Michelle up speed.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: ...now the Bulgarian’s guys have Brooks and the only way to save him is to get that egg back from this Marlon Freeman guy.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Man. I can’t believe your brother has been lying to us this whole time. (beat) He’s even cooler than we thought!

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I didn’t even know Morgan Freeman collected Fabergé eggs. Aren’t those worth millions of dollars?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Marlon Freeman. But that’s just an alias. Somehow we need to find his real name and address.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Police computer.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I once dated this girl who’s dad was a cop. She had these big, thick legs but not a trace of flab. Solid muscle. She looked like the mom in “The Incredibles.” Y‘know? Tiny little waist but then it V's out-—

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Why are you telling us this?!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. She showed me her dad's police computer one time. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s got this database with every known alias. I bet you could find Marlon Wayans’ real name on that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: If you called her do you think she’d let you use her dad’s computer again?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No way. It ended very badly.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: I’m shocked.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Well, how are we gonna get ona police computer without the cops knowing?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I've got it! They all turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Billy Bob Thornton.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (to Michelle) You slept with Billy Bob Thornton, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Then why was he so friendly to you that one time at 24 Hour Fitness? It felt like you already knew each other.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: That wasn’t Billy Bob Thornton! That was Shawn, my dental hygienist.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: That's awfully convenient, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: For who?  70.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Everyone shut up for a second. (then) I know where we can get on a police computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary opens the door on Max, Annie, Ryan, Jillian, Kevin a Michelle, all wearing unnaturally wide smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Heeeyyy, Gare.... REVERSE TO REVEAL: Gary, a lamb shank in one hand, Bastia the dog in the other. A napkin tucked into his police uniform. From inside we can hear the faint, tinny sound o Al Jolson crooning “Toot, Toot, Tootsie!”

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Goodness. To what do Bastian and I owe the pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We were all talking and we realized we haven’t had a game night in ages. Just the seven of us.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (dubious ) It’s ten o’clock. And I thought you were going to your brother's house.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: He was tied up. (realizing) With work.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Gare Bear, it’s the weekend. Live a little.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: We were just saying how you were always better at games than Debbie was.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (intense) I‘1l thank you not to besmirch my ex-wife. That woman is an angel.  71.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (backtracking) Whoa. Okay. No, I mean I like her. We all like her. Gary's wild-eyed look gives way to a smile.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I will admit, I have eagerly awaited a visit such as this. He backs into the darkness of his house and the creepy 19 music.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Do we follow him?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Seems like it.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (pushing Ryan) You go first.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'm afraid. They all nervously enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group sit around a coffee table as Jillian finishes building a Jenga tower. Gary enters with a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Help yourselves to popped corn with sea salt. Gary plops the bowl in Max’s arms right on his covered wo

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (wincing) ARRGGHHHH... (covering) I love popped corn! Ryan notices a framed photo on a table. It shows the game night group, including Gary’s ex-wife Debbie, with Gary looming in the background.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You have a framed photo of game night?  72.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t everyone have photos of their best friends in their homes? The group exchange guilty looks.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Of course. Max, you want to go first? Max takes out the first piece then stands.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, could I use your bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Of course. Just down the hall, past our bedr-- (he shuts his eyes, pained) --my bedroom. The others give Max a knowing look as he heads off. Basti the dog trots after Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hurries to the bathroom, turns on the light and fan, closes the door without going in. He spots another room a quickly ducks inside. Bastian follows. INT. GARY’S STUDY - NIGHT The room is a SHRINE to Debbie. Photos, keepsakes, embroidered pillows, greeting cards, an ENORMOUS WEDDING PHOTO of her and Gary over the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Jesus. He spots a reinforced police laptop on the desk and opens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle carefully slides a piece out of the Jenga tower. There are four players left before Max’s turn.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So, Jillian. How long have you and Ryan been a couple?  73.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, no. We just work together.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I see. I thought I detected a certain chemistry between the two of you. Jillian and Ryan do their best to laugh this off.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then again, I’m not the world’s best judge of chemistry. He lets out THE MOST MIRTHLESS LAUGH IN HISTORY. The othe look deeply uncomfortable. BACK IN THE STUDY, Max has pulled up the National Police Database and enters “Marlon Freeman.” A profile comes up showing a surveillance photo of a distinguished white man his 40's, PETER ANDERTON. His suspected crimes include trafficking in stolen artifacts, insider trading, illegal weapons sales, etc.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hello, Peter Anderton... Max doesn’t notice a DROP OF BLOOD from his bullet wound trickled down his arm and landed on the beige carpet. Bastian walks over and sniffs it curiously. PLOP. Another drop lands on the dog’s fluffy white fur. BACK IN THE LIVING ROOM Annie is staring at the Jenga tow

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (stalling) So many possible moves...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Annie. Make up your mind. Jillian elbows him in the ribs. He realizes.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. Take your time. Gary looks at them, nonplussed. BACK IN THE STUDY. By now BASTIAN’S COAT IS SPATTERED WIT BLOOD but Max has yet to notice. He writes down Anderton’ address on a pad, starts to shut the laptop but reconside He types “The Bulgarian” into the alias search window. A blurry photo of a burly man appears. “Real Name: Unknown.  74. Address: Unknown.” There’s an extensive list ot suspected crimes: multiple murders, torture, kidnapping, human trafficking, arms trafficking, etc.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh, Brooks. What did you get yourself into...? He closes the window and shuts the computer and heads for door. He notices his arm is leaking blood, then sees A TR OF BLOOD DROPS leading across the carpet to Bastian who i now more red than white.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! He shuts the door, then hurries back to the dog and tries rubbing off the blood with his hand, but it only smears i He looks around and spots what looks like a rolled up rag a shelf. He hastily begins rubbing the dog with the rag b it has little effect.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god. He spits on the dog’s back and rubs it some more. Not helping. He sees a bottle of water on the desk. As he moves to gra it, he accidentally knocks over a ceramic wedding cake topper. The bride’s head breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! BACK IN THE LIVING ROOM the others hear Max cry out.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (standing) Maybe I should check on Max.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I’m sure he’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: He cried out. He moves to go. The others looks at each other desperatel

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (blurting) Tell me about Debbie! Gary stops, facing away from them.  75.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: I never got to meet her. I'd love to hear what she’s like. Gary sits back down, looking wistful.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Where do I begin? BACK IN THE STUDY. Max is pouring water onto Bastian and scrubbing him with the rag. Fresh blood continues to seep out onto the dog, making him even messier.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This is not working... He unrolls the rag and reacts as he sees it’s not a rag b SOUVENIR T-SHIRT with a photo showing a smiling Debbie on beach on vacation. The image is smeared with blood.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course. Just then, the wet dog SHAKES HIMSELF OFF vigorously. BLO WATER FLIES EVERYWHERE, spattering the walls of the room including the enormous wedding photo. Gary’s shrine to Debbie now looks more like the scene of murder. Max stands and takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sighs) Fuck this. He wraps the shirt around his arm, covers it with his jac then leaves the room, closing the door on the fluffy, pin dog and the blood-spattered room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary regales the group with memories.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: ...-when she laughed it was like a concerto and if you were there to hear it, you considered yourself lucky just to be in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Kevin) I don’t remember her laugh being that great.  76. Max enters.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We should go.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What? But you haven’t taken your turn at the Jenga tower.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Right. He reaches down and deliberately knocks over the tower.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Darn it. Let’s go. Thank you, Gary. This was great. The others quickly stand, ad lib goodbyes and head out.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: When shall we play next?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We’ll call you. And they’re gone. Gary stands there for a moment. Then,

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Bastian? INT. KEVIN AND MICHELLE’S VAN - NIGHT Kevin drives the group in his Honda Odyssey.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: So what do we do when we get to Peter Anderton’s house? Knock on his door and ask for his million dollar egg back?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe if I explain the situation he’ll want to help.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh, yeah, most criminal millionaires have hearts of gold. SFX: Max's recharged cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Private number. Please don’t be Gary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DISTORTED MALE VOICE, (ON SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: We have your brother.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Okay, listen. We know who has the egg. We’re on our way there right now. We can do a trade. Please don’t hurt Brooks. There’s a long pause on the line.

dialogues.speaker: DISTORTED MALE VOICE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Meet us on the East 4th Street Bridge at midnight. If you’re late he dies.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That’s only an hour from now-- But the caller hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Those guys aren’t fucking around. Dude sounded like Kylo Ren.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We're here. The van pulls up to what appears to be a large gated esta surrounded by a tall hedge. Max starts to get out.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You guys head back to the house. I’1l call you as soon as I have the egg.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We’re coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No way. It could be really dangerous in there. Brooks shouldn’t have dragged any of us into his mess. But he’s my brother and it’s up to me to fix this.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Bullshit. We’re all in this together.  78.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You know we'd do anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No. Max is right. You guys should go home. This is our problem.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: And what happens if you don’t make it out?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what game night means to us? We don’t come over because we’re dying to play charades and stupid ass children’s shit. We come over because we love you guys.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: It’s the best part of our week.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Mine too. And I’ve got a lot of options on the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Brooks may be your brother. But we're all family here. Max and Annie are visibly touched.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We love you guys too. There’s a nice beat, then they all realize Jillian is the

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You should totally go home, though. You don’t even know us.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You're right. I don’t. But if you guys are cool with it, I’d like to stay.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: This has been the most exciting night of my life. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most Friday nights I eat a Chipotle bowl by myself and watch “Orange is the New Black” on my iPad.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what I imagined. She elbows him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You've got an open invitation to all future game nights, Jillian.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: As long as we don’t die tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, how are we gonna get into this place? Just then, a car pulls up to the intercom and the gate op

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Go, go, go! Kevin drives in behind the other car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin’s van pulls up to where a couple dozen expensive ca are parked in the driveway. The house is lit up and shout can be heard from inside. The group steps out of the van.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Looks like they’re having a party.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That could be good. We can get in there and look for the egg without anyone noticing us. They approach the house and peek in a window. Inside they see A SCULPTURE OF A SHARK SUBMERGED IN FORMALDEHYDE alon with recognizable modern paintings on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Damn. Warhol, Rothko, Damien Hirst. This guy’s gotta have the egg. They peer into the kitchen where we see a chef handing tr of hors d’oeuvres to several CATERERS.  80.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan? We knock out six of those caterers, drag them into a closet and come out wearing their clothes?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You gonna knock out six innocent people and strip them naked?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You got a better plan?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. We wear our own clothes and look for the fucking egg. Now come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group enter to find a crowd of well-dressed MEN and a handful of WOMEN in their 40’s and 50’s huddled around something we can’t see. They’re cheering and throwing dow hundred dollar bills. Attractive COCKTAIL WAITRESSES serv drinks. Our guys stick out from the crowd, but no one seems to notice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What is this? They see an opening in the crowd and react: in the center BARE-KNUCKLED WHITE MEN in their 30’s are pummeling the s out of each other.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: It’s some kind of rich guys’ fight club. They all turn to Ryan who gasps.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I knew it! I told you they were real! Just then, one of the two combatants, BOOMER, KNOCKS THE OTHER ONE UNCONSCIOUS. A distinguished 40-something man, MR. ANDERTON, lets out a celebratory shout as he holds up Boomer’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: That’s my Boomer!  81. He plants a kiss on Boomer’s sweaty, bald head, then slap him on the back like a racehorse.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: This is some Django Unchained bullshit. Anderton mocks one of his guests, WARREN.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: Sorry, Warren. Don’t think you’re gonna be able to amortize that loss. Several of the guests laugh and jeer Warren. Anderton hol up a water bottle that Boomer suckles from.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kramer! Get Logan ready. Minimum buy-in is now ten grand. Another rich guy leads his muscly fighter, LOGAN, into th “ring.”

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Rich people are fucked up, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: All right, let’s split up. Anyone finds the egg, text the others. And for god’s sake be careful with it. It’s the only chance Brooks has. Max and Annie, Kevin and Michelle head off. Jillian goes leave but notices Ryan is moving closer to the fight whic has just begun.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I’ve got a good feeling about Logan. Do you have ten grand on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and Michelle stealthily enter a lavish bedroom and begin looking around.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Wow. This is the biggest bedroom I’ve ever seen.  82.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Bigger than your celebrity boyfriend's?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You're still on this?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You gotta tell me who he was, Michelle. It’s all I can think about. And that’s saying something considering there’s a fight club downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Why does it matter so much?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We’ve been together our whole lives. And I thought I knew everything about you. Now I find out there’s this huge secret you’ve been keeping from me. I’m not mad that you slept with someone while we were on a break. I’m sad that you felt you had to keep it from me. Michelle stares at him for a beat. Finally,

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Glenn Close.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: The celebrity I slept with. It was Glenn Close.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of town.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I was a waitress at the premiere party of “102 Dalmations.” I was about to start freshman year at William and Mary and it turned out Glenn went there too. We started talking and we ended up back at her house. We were both a little drunk and one thing led to another.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: It was just that one time?  83.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I haven’t seen or spoken to her since. (beat) I always knew you and I weren’t gonna be apart for long and I wanted to do something crazy while I had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: So you made love to Cruella DeVille.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Are you upset?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No, baby. I’m glad you got it out of your system. And by the way, well done. Glenn Close is a national treasure. I wish you had told me years ago.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I didn’t think you'd take it this well.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Now, if you’d told me it was Denzel I would've killed myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Annie search through a beautiful wood and leather library. She notices photos on the shelves showing Andert with a TROPHY WIFE and FIVE KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: How can this monster have five kids and we can’t even make one?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Well, his wife looks like she’s about fifteen. (then, distracted) Don’t worry. We’ll get there.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I’m starting to feel like I’m pushing this baby thing on you.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No. It’s just-- when we first met we did whatever we wanted. Whenever we wanted. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then we got real jobs and a mortgage and car loans and now we only have one night of the week where we get to let loose and have fun. Game night. And once we have a kid, we won’t even have that anymore. Annie suddenly realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You weren’t stressed because your brother was coming to town. You’re stressed because you didn’t want to have a kid in the first place. Your sperm doesn’t work because you're afraid your sperm might work. Max looks away. He knows she’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: How about we put a pin in this until my brother is safe?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Off Annie’s sad look,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan watches raptly as Logan and Boomer beat the hell out each other. Jillian is losing patience.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Logan! Boomer ain’t shit!

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Can we go? We’re supposed to be looking for the-- Suddenly, she notices one of Anderton’s EMPLOYEES banding together a stack of bills he’s taken from a money counter He places the cash in a wall safe but does not shut it. J beside the stacked cash Jillian spots A BEJEWELED, ORNATE DECORATED FABERGE EGG.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. (she pokes Ryan) Look. It’s right there!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Good eyes. Stay here.  85. He heads ott.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I’m gonna grab it. They’re all watching the fight. He casually weaves through the crowd of shouting men to t open wall safe. He glances around. No one has noticed him He grabs the egg. Just then, POW! Boomer delivers a crippling blow to Logan knocking him out. The crowd roars. Boomer looks up and stares quizzically at Ryan. Everyone else follows his gaz The room goes silent. All eyes are on Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: What are you doing with my egg?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (adopting a fake air of haughtiness) I was... simply admiring it. It’s a fine specimen. I have dozens of such eggs in my collection. I’ma bit of a connoisseur if you will.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: Does anyone here know this guy?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Everyone knows me. I’m a mogul like you gentlemen. And after a hard day of selling stocks and acquiring assets, I like to unwind with a cognac and a good fight. I’m a bit of a connoisseur if you will. Jillian buries her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: You're full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How dare ye?  86.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERTON
dialogues.text: (to Boomer) Take this guy down, please. Boomer shoves through the crowd toward Ryan who bolts wit the egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Annie rejoin Kevin and Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah! We actually worked out our issue.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I’m talking about the egg!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Nothing. Suddenly, Ryan and Jillian CHARGE PAST THEM. Ryan holds t egg and looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (shouting) Go, go, go! Boomer rushes in hot on Ryan’s tail. The others scramble. Ryan stumbles and DROPS the egg. It is caught just in tim by Annie who laterals it to Michelle. Boomer pursues whoe holds the egg and it turns into a_high-stakes game of “ho potato.” Finally, Jillian finds herself holding the egg with no on pass it to. She stands like a deer in headlights as Boome charges straight for her. At the last possible second, the fighter is TACKLED FROM SIDE BY RYAN who has instinctively leapt to Jillian's aid The two men CRASH into the Damien Hirst shark artwork. Th

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh god! Boomer is dazed. Ryan clambers to his feet, stumbling ove the rubbery fish corpse and the group races out of the ho  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and the others run toward Kevin's minivan. Anderton a his guests pour out the door in pursuit. A soaking wet Boomer leads the charge as our group piles into the Odyss

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Come on! Get in! He floors it and they speed down the driveway and out to street. INT. KEVIN’S CAR - NIGHT Everyone catches their breath as Kevin speeds along. Max holds the egg.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Well, that was unusual. Jillian turns to Ryan who looks dazed.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You really saved me back there.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why did I do that? It’s like I saw you were in trouble and this feeling came over me. Like I wanted to help you even if I didn’t get anything out of it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Sounds like love, Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What? Ew. No, it doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Gross, Annie. But as they blow off the moment, we can see both Ryan and Jillian are in uncharted territory.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (tense) Two minutes to twelve. Where’s this bridge?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: GPS says it’s right around here but I don’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (points) There it is! 4th Street.  88. Seeing they’re passing the bridge, Kevin SLAMS ON THE BRA In SUPER-SLOW MOTION, we see the egg fly out of Max’s han

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuucccecckkkkkkk! The egg passes between the front seats and SHATTERS AGAIN THE FRONT WINDSHIELD. Jewels and enamel fly all over the dashboard. After a beat,

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: That’s it. They’re gonna kill my brother.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hang on. Maybe we can fix this... Ryan picks up a few shards of egg and tries piecing them together but they fall apart in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is more fragile than a real egg. (then) Did they specifically say it had to be in one piece? Michelle examines some of the tiny gems on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I’m not an expert, but these gems look kinda plastic to me. Max leans forward and examines some of the pieces. Inside one he notices a small sticker.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (reading) “Made in China”? Is this thing not even real?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Maybe just that sticker was made in China.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Let’s let them talk.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Why would the Bulgarian ask Brooks to get him a fake egg?  89. Annie notices something amidst the shattered egg. A TINY ROLLED UP PAPER. She picks it up and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t think he wanted the egg at all. I think he wanted what was inside of it. INSERT on the roll of paper. It’s a list of names and addresses in tiny type. At the top is a header: “WITSEC.”

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: “WITSEC"? What is that?

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: We can ask them. She points to the opposite end of the bridge where we can a black van coming to a stop. Ponytail and Bald Guy step out, open the rear door and drag out a frightened Brooks. Our group steels themselves as they climb out of the mini Ryan scoops the shattered egg pieces into a travel mug. Jillian looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: In case they ask for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, Annie and the others move nervously to where the thu stand in the middle of the bridge holding guns on Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: You tell anyone you were coming here?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No. I swear. Listen, we've got your egg--

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: You do?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: But we broke it.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: What?! Ryan shakes the travel mug helpfully.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It was a fake. But we have the list of names inside. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (holding it up) That’s what you wanted, right? The thugs exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: Get on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We have what you want. Why can’t you just let us go? Ponytail shoves his gun in Max's face.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: I said “on the ground”! They all lie down on their stomachs. Brooks lies beside M Ponytail begins moving down the line, collecting wallets cell phones. Bald Guy takes out his own phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: (into phone) It’s me. We’ve got ‘em all here. As Bald Guy walks off to talk, Brooks turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: The Bulgarian’s gonna kill me. Probably you guys too. Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You're my brother. I can’t just let you die. Even if you deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable. You were always a better person than me.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Please shut up.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I’m being serious. Max rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I haven’t been totally honest with you.  91.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah, Brooks, I know. That’s why we're lying on a bridge at midnight.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I don’t mean about this. I mean about everything. I’m not the guy you think I am. I’m not even the guy you think I think I am.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I’m a fraud. Everyone sees me as this cool, carefree dude who wins at everything he touches. Well, you know how I win? I cheat, Max. I cheat at everything. Even when we were little kids and we would play Battleship.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Didn’t you notice how I always made you sit with your back to the TV? It was so I could see where your ships were in the reflection. And I always pocketed five grand in Monopoly before we even started playing. I cheated at the Game of Life. And the game of life.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: But it didn’t stop there. We grew up and you went to college and met Annie and became a writer. I knew I couldn't compete with your success. So I told everyone I got a job on Wall Street. And I did. Selling coke to the traders.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You never were a venture capitalist?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: I’m not even sure what “venture capitalist” means.  92.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: So this whole time that I’ve felt like a complete failure next to you, you've felt the same way about me?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Kinda funny, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No! It’s not funny! It’s shitty! You turned me into a self-doubting, competitive mess! You even broke my sperm!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m not sure what that last thing means, but listen. I’ve been trying to find a way to make it up to you. That’s what this whole game night was supposed to be. I rigged it so you would finally win. The last clue was gonna lead you to your jacket pocket. Puzzled, Max reaches into his jacket pocket and pulls out key to Brooks’ Stingray.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Surprise. But I even fucked that up. I’m so sorry, man. He puts his forehead on the asphalt, defeated. Max puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You know what? We’re gonna be okay. I can feel it. ANGLE ON Bald Guy finishing his call.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: (into phone) .--all of them? You sure that’s necessary? (beat) Okay. He hangs up and turns to Ponytail.

dialogues.speaker: PONYTAIL
dialogues.text: What’d he say?  They cock Panicked, They kiss. 93.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: We gotta take ‘em all out. their guns. Our group all react, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (to the thugs) Wait! We got you the list!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Just let us go. No one needs to know!

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (to Kevin) I’m sorry I fucked Glenn Close.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I fucked Karen Waller.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You said it was a handjob! Ryan turns to Jillian.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire) I know you’re too smart for me and you could do way better, but I really like you and I might love you! Do you love me?!

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think so, but if you want to kiss I’d be okay with that.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fair enough! Then,

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You smell like a preserved shark. Ponytail and Bald Guy point their guns. They’re about to fire when-- WOOOP! The chirp of a POLICE CAR SIREN startl everyone. They turn

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Freeze! to see-- GARY STEPPING OUT OF HIS COP CAR LIKE A HERO. His weapon is drawn.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Gary?!  94. Bald Guy and Ponytail turn their guns on Gary.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it, pig!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Can't say I care for that nomenclature. Gary FIRES his gun at them. Bald Guy and Ponytail dive fo cover, returning fire. It’s real and loud and scary. Everybody scatters, screaming. Ryan covers Jillian. Max falls on top of Annie. Michelle falls on top of Kevin. Gary slides across his car’s hood like John McClane, firi at the thugs. Ponytail gets hit in the gut, his shirt EXPLODING with red. Gary aims and fires. Bald Guy ducks too late and gets hit the back, dropping like a sack. A beat of quiet.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Is that your neighbor?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (shaken) Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Is everybody okay?!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: When did Gary get so cool?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Gary?! You all right? Gary emerges from cover.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m fine. (looking back) Though in sliding, my belt buckle may have scratched the finish of my squad car.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: How did you know we were in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: The nocturnal Jenga game, my blood- spattered marital souvenirs and Max's curious search history piqued my interest.  95.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You saved our lives.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just doing my jo-- BANG! Gary's chest explodes in an eruption of BLOOD. He falls to the ground in a heap. We see that Ponytail has fired one last shot before dying

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Annie tries putting pressure on the wound. Max pulls Gary into his lap as Jillian calls 911--

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I need an ambulance, there’s an officer down....

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Gary! Hold on! Gary looks down at his chest.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh no... Ryan dry heaves.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You’re gonna be fine, Gary! Just hang on! Gary coughs and a little blood comes out of his mouth. Hi eyelids get heavier.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hang on, Gare. We’re gonna get you to the hospital!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You've got so much to live for!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (weak) Do I? I have no wife. No friends.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We're your friends, pal.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We all love you. Ryan looks at Kevin. He shrugs.  96.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You don’t... even like spending time... with me.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (choked up) Not true. We've just been selfish. We didn’t think about you and what you needed. I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Someone please care for Bastian.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You're gonna care for him yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. And when you get out of the hospital you’re coming to every game night we have. You hear me?! That’s a promise! Annie takes his hand, trying not to cry--

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Would you like that, Gary? Would you like to come back to game night? You've just gotta keep breathing. A very weakened Gary tries to smile. He leans up like he wants to say something, but he’s too weak. Max and Annie lean down close...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (softly) Don’t you EVER exclude me again.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What? A beat. Then Gary SPITS OUT what looks to be a plastic packet from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What’s that? What was that?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: And that is how you do a murder mystery party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary gets to his feet, grinning. Kevin SCREAMS when she s Bald Guy and Ponytail stand up, very much still alive, brushing themselves off.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?!  Gary nods. head off. 97.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’ve duped you all.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: This was all... a game?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (furious) A game?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: When I learned that you stopped inviting me to your game nights, I hijacked Brooks’ murder mystery party and staged a kidnapping of my own.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Okay, y’know what? False alarm. Officer not down. He’s back up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What better way to prove my worth as a game night participant?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (points to Bald Guy and Ponytail) So who are those guys? Actors?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh, no, they’re felons. I was able to shave some time off their parole in exchange for this little side project. (then) Thank you, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: BALD GUY
dialogues.text: We square now? Ponytail and Bald Guy collect their props and

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (to Gary) What kind of psycho are you?! You put us through all this shit for your own amusement?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just the opposite. For your amusement. Did everyone have fun?  98.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: No, Gary. Nobody had fun. And I got shot with a real bullet!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I don’t see how that’s possible. My men were using blanks.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: That was my gun. Which was real.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to Gary) So, the whole thing with the Fabergé egg and the Bulgarian. That was you?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You’ve lost me.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The egg with the WITSEC list inside. Max shows him the paper.

dialogues.speaker: WITSEC
dialogues.text: (reading) This is a list of people in the federal witness protection program. How did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It was in the egg! Can you please stop fucking with us now?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m not fudging with you. I honestly don’t know what-- BANG! Gary is hit in the shoulder by a bullet. Blood spur out. Gary falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Seriously? How stupid do you think we are? Brooks spots a BURLY MAN with two armed BODYGUARDS approaching from the other end of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (pointing) Max?  99.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: (to Gary) That’s your big twist? You get shot again? And by who? Completely new characters you just introduce at the last minute? I’m sorry. You jumped the shark, bud.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: No, Max...

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: And you don’t do a shot in the shoulder after you did a shot in the chest. That’s anti-climactic. He sticks his finger into Gary’s bullet hole. Gary SCREAM in pain. Max pulls out his finger.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (confused) Hang on... Gary reaches for his shoulder walkie.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (pained) This is Officer Henson. I’ve got a ten-double-zero on the 4th Street-- One of the Bodyguards suddenly KICKS GARY IN THE HEAD, knocking him unconscious. It’s clear this is not staged.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Jesus! The Bodyguard picks up the gun Gary dropped and hands it his boss, THE BULGARIAN.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Which one of you is Brooks Davis? Brooks nervously holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Funny. You don’t look like an asshole. Do I look like an asshole to you?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: One of us has to be the asshole in this transaction because otherwise I'd have my egg and you’d have your money. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But instead, we’ve wasted our night tracking you down. We find Marlon Freeman. He tells us some idiots in a minivan stole the egg. Now we've shot and kicked this perfectly innocent policeman, and now we’re gonna have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Bulgarian? If I may. I’m Brooks’ brother. He screwed up. He got greedy. He knows that. But the good news is, we got your egg back. Granted, it’s broken. But we got the list inside. And I bet that’s what you wanted all along. So how about this? You take the list. For free. We all go our separate ways and nobody gets hurt. (then, grim) Except for the people on that list, I’m guessing. Max holds up the list.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Deal. Makes perfect sense. Max moves to hand the list over but Brooks stops him.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Wait. You give him that he’s gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Nonsense. (then, dead serious) Give me the list. Max hesitates. The Bulgarian nods to his guys who aim the guns at Brooks and Max. In an instant, Brooks grabs the l from Max, shoves it in his mouth and swallows it.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?! SFX: a distant SIREN WAILS as it comes closer

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Just buying myself some time.  101.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Not much. We’re just gonna cut you open on the jet. (to Bodyguards) Take him. One Bodyguard grabs Brooks. The other points to the group

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Fuck ‘em. We’1ll be out of the country in an hour. They back up towards their car, one gun on Brooks, one gu the rest of them. Max watches helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Don't follow me, Max. I’m serious.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: I’m not worried about that. He takes out a gun. Max flinches. The Bulgarian SHOOTS OU two tires on Kevin’s minivan. Max’s face hardens as he watches the car drive away.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Man. This game just gets weirder and weirder. Everyone looks at Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: You know it stopped being a game, right?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (covering) Duh.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The only private air terminal around here is at LAX. Max starts to head off.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You gonna run there?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We’re only four blocks from Brooks’ house.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: But our car’s not there.  102. Max holds up the key to the Stingray.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. He runs off. Annie sighs and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Bodyguards shuts the door of a Cessna private as it begins to taxi toward the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He joins the other Bodyguard who is zip-tying Brooks’ han to the arm of a seat. The Bulgarian looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (struggling) Look, you don’t have to do this. Just let me poop it out.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: We’re not going to go digging around in your feces. We’re civilized men. He takes out a LARGE KNIFE from a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now hold still while I cut your stomach open.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Wait! 1I’11 do whatever you need me to do! He is about to cut when Brooks notices something outside.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hell? The Bulgarian looks out and sees a CORVETTE STINGRAY SMAS through the chain-link fence along the runway and speedin right toward the taxiing jet.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: (proud) My little brother. He doesn’t know when to quit. The Bulgarian turns to the cockpit and barks at the PILOT  103.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Get us in the air! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frazzled, Max and Annie chase the jet down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: What’s our plan?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: The plan was to break through the fence! Now, I’ve got nothing!

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: They’re about to take off! Max steels himself and pours on more speed.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: All right. I’ve got an idea that’s crazy enough it just might work.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You're gonna crash the car into the plane?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Yeah. How’d you know?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause it’s the only option!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet is nearly lifting off the ground as the Stingray pulls up alongside. Max turns the wheel hard to the left RAMS into the side of the plane. The jet VEERS OFF COURSE, barreling toward the edge of th runway. It speeds over the berm and slams to a stop ina ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOTS are thrown against the controls and knocked unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bodyguards, the Bulgarian and Brooks are slammed agai the cabin walls.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The totaled car spins out, coming to a halt on the runway INT. KEVIN’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Max and Annie take a breath.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Well, at least I got to drive it for ten minutes. Annie sees the door of the jet open as one of the armed Bodyguards steps out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Quick. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps out of the car and heads across the tarmac away from the approaching Bodyguard. Max moves to follow but the Bodyguard is already looking his direction. Max ducks behind the Stingray just in time The Bodyguard peers inside the car then heads right towar where Max is hiding. Just as he’s about to find Max, Annie stumbles and makes noise. The Bodyguard turns toward the sound as Annie duck for cover behind a baggage conveyor belt loader parked alongside the tarmac. The Bodyguard toward her. Annie hides on the other side o the loader as the Bodyguard looks for her. She and Max lo eyes from their hiding places. Frantic to help her, Max suddenly notices a LARGE CRATE perched at the top of the elevated conveyor belt directly above the Bodyguard. Max points at the crate and silently mouths “turn on the belt.” She doesn’t know what he’s talking about. He takes out his cell phone to text her: No service.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Shit. He gets an idea. He begins to CHARADE to her. He holds up three fingers. It takes a second but Annie gets it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Three words.  105. Max does the tirst word. He spins in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Spin. Turn. Yes. Second word: he puts one hand on top of the other.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On. Turn on what? Max points to his belt.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Belt. Turn on belt. She catches on. She sneaks around to the control panel of the loader and finds the activation switch. She’s about to hit it but Max gestures for her to wait. T Bodyguard circles around the loader. Annie scurries aroun it, ducking out of his view. Finally, the Bodyguard returns to the spot beneath the cr Max signals. Annie turns on the conveyor... ..-which starts up with a DEAFENING GROWL of its gas engi The conveyor CREEPS UP SUPER-SLOWLY giving the Bodyguard ample time to see the crate and step out of the way as it smashes harmlessly to the ground. Max throws up his hands But while the Bodyguard is distracted, he is BONKED in th head by Annie wielding a fire extinguisher she removed fr the loader. He goes down hard. Annie grabs the Bodyguard’s gun and runs to join Max.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You saw what I was going for there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Of course. If that guy had been deaf and paralyzed it totally would’ve worked. (re: the gun) You want this?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: I know I don’t want you to have it, Calamity Jane. He takes the gun and they sneak over toward the jet.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look. There’s a hatch on top of the plane! Maybe I can get the drop on them.  106. Max puts the gun over his shoulder and caretully begins climbing up onto the wing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: “The drop”?!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Get to the hangar. See if you can find a cop or something. I’11 be okay.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (whisper yell) You’re not Jack Reacher!

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: We're sitting ducks here. Get out there, kill those fuckers and find me another plane!

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: (re: Brooks) You okay with him? The Bulgarian picks up his knife.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, we’ll be fine. As the Bodyguard hurries out of the plane, the Bulgarian approaches Brooks.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No more waiting. I’m getting my list. We hear a rattling from the ceiling of the plane. The Bulgarian steps aside just as Max falls through the emerg hatch, missing the Bulgarian and landing on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Max!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Can’t get the drop on anyone tonight. Before the Bulgarian can react, Max aims his gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drop the knife.  107. But instead, the Bulgarian THROWS the knite at Max. It sticks into the same arm where he was shot earlier. Max drops his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ARGGGHH! Right in my bullet hole! The Bulgarian charges Max but Brooks TRIPS him with his l The Bulgarian falls to the floor and he and Max grapple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bodyguard searches around the plane, his gun drawn. H spots Annie hiding behind the nose of the jet and FIRES. runs for cover but he has her trapped.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Wait! I have kids! Four of them!

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Not with that ass you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (flattered) Well, thank you for that. He raises his gun and aims at her head.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and the Bulgarian continue to wrestle. They stumble i the cockpit landing between the unconscious pilots direct on top of the THRUST LEVER. The engine ROARS TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine directly behind the Bodyguard suddenly REVS to maximum throttle. The man turns back to look.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: What the f--? WHOOSH... SPLAT! He’s SUCKED into the engine and shredded

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yes! (then, grim) Oh my god. That’s just horrible.  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight spills back into the cabin as the Bulgarian spo the gun Max dropped on the floor. He clambers toward it. Brooks sticks out his leg and TRIPS HIM AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULGARIAN
dialogues.text: Stop tripping me! Max notices a BUNGEE CORD dangling from an overhead compartment. He grabs it and wraps it around the Bulgaria neck. But the Bulgarian is determined. He continues to crawl to the weapon as the cord tightens around his throa Just as his hand grasps the gun, he collapses on the floo unconscious from lack of oxygen. Max quickly ties him up with the bungee cord so he can’t move. He cuts Brooks free with the Bulgarian’s knife. The two brothers stand there as they collect themselves.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Look at that. ANGLE ON the Bulgarian. Max has wrapped him so his head i nearly in his own crotch.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You get a bungee cord in your hand and you go straight to the pervy place, don’t you? Annie hurries onto the plane and hugs Max.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I mean, I’m changed forever but I’m fine. (then) Is that a knife in your bullet hole?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s nothing. Listen, I want us to have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Look at us. We did things tonight we never would’ve imagined we could do. And we were awesome. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought I wanted to be like Brooks but it turns out Brooks is a low-life and a loser.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Guilty.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Plus, think of all the dum-dums having babies out there. Ours is going to be so much better. It/’1l beat them at everything.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (getting into it) Totally. Our baby’s gonna crush every other baby!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: We’re gonna raise the Jason Bourne of babies.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: But without all the creepy Treadstone flashbacks.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Right, no. Obviously. Brooks starts slow-clapping. They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: And that is how you throw a game night. Max and Annie stare.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: It went exactly as I planned. (to the Bulgarian) Trevor, you can get up now. Max and Annie exchange an incredulous look and turn to th Bulgarian. He doesn’t move. There’s a beat.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m just fucking with you. That would’ve been cool though, right?

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Such a dick.  110. EXT. BROOKS’ HOUSE - NIGHT SUPER: “3 MONTHS LATER” Max and Annie head toward Brooks’ rented house. INT. BROOKS’ HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Max and Annie enter to find a game night in progress. Kev Michelle, Ryan and Jillian play “Pictionary.” We see the player at the easel is Gary. They all yell greetings. Brooks hands Max a drink.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me host again.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: It’s not like we have a choice. REVEAL that Brooks is wearing A BLINKING HOUSE ARREST ANK BRACELET.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Only for another 36 months. Brooks sits down on the sofa and puts an arm around DR. C the fertility doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DR. CHIN
dialogues.text: Hi guys!

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Hey, Dr. Chin.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (re: Gary’s drawing) “The Crying Game”? We see Gary’s drawing is of a man crying.

dialogues.speaker: JILLIAN
dialogues.text: “Boys Don’t Cry”?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: “Cry-Baby”? Ryan’s phone BUZZER sounds.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Time's up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It was “The Green Mile.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that “The Green Mile”?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That’s me at the Regal Cinema, crying, as I did through much of the film.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to know that, Gary?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I assume everyone cried during “The Green Mile.”

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (whispering to Kevin and Michelle) How long till we can stop inviting him again?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKS
dialogues.text: Who’s next?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I’ll go. 111. Annie gets up and grabs the pen. She pulls out her clue, reads it, tosses it behind her, nods for the timer, and starts drawing a bread roll.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: A rock. A ball.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: A burger. A bun! She nods, then draws an oven around the bun.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Wait, is this a motion picture? She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: Baking a bun. In an oven. There’s a bun in the oven! Annie touches her nose, smiling. Max jumps up, his win, but then:

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait-- what? He turns to Annie: she’s holding her stomach. celebrating  112.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We did it. Max smiles and hugs her as everyone cheers and congratula them. WE MOVE OUT A WINDOW where the happy tableau plays in the living room. Suddenly, an ominous BLACK VAN pulls to a stop in front o the house as we SMASH TO BLACK.
